content:
FileTracker Class

Definition

This class contains utility functions to encapsulate launching and logging for the Tracker

In this Article

public static class FileTracker
Inheritance
System.Object
FileTracker

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Methods

CreateRootingMarkerResponseFile(ITaskItem[])

Given a set of source files in the form of ITaskItem, creates a temporary response file containing the rooting marker that corresponds to those sources.

public static string CreateRootingMarkerResponseFile (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] sources);
sources
ITaskItem[]

The set of source files.

Returns
String

The response file path.

CreateRootingMarkerResponseFile(String)

Given a rooting marker, creates a temporary response file with that rooting marker in it.

public static string CreateRootingMarkerResponseFile (string rootMarker);
rootMarker
String

The rooting marker to put in the response file.

Returns
String

The response file path.

EndTrackingContext()

Stops tracking file accesses.

public static void EndTrackingContext ();

EnsureFileTrackerOnPath()

Prepends the path to the appropriate FileTracker assembly to the PATH environment variable. Used for inproc tracking.

public static string EnsureFileTrackerOnPath ();
Returns
String

The old value of the PATH environment variable.

EnsureFileTrackerOnPath(String)

Prepends the path to the appropriate FileTracker assembly to the PATH environment variable. Used for inproc tracking, or when the .NET Framework may not be on the PATH.

public static string EnsureFileTrackerOnPath (string rootPath);
rootPath
String

The root path for FileTracker.dll. Overrides the toolType if specified.

Returns
String

The old value of PATH

FileIsExcludedFromDependencies(String)

Test to see if the specified file is excluded from tracked dependencies

public static bool FileIsExcludedFromDependencies (string fileName);
fileName
String

Full path of the file to test

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the file is excluded.

FileIsUnderPath(String,String)

Test to see if the specified file is under the specified path

public static bool FileIsUnderPath (string fileName, string path);
fileName
String

Full path of the file to test

path
String

The path that might contain the file.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the file is under the path.

FindTrackerOnPath()

Searches %PATH% for the location of Tracker.exe, and returns the first path that matches.Matching full path to Tracker.exe or null if a matching path is not found.

public static string FindTrackerOnPath ();
Returns
String

Returns the path to Tracker.exe.

ForceOutOfProcTracking(ExecutableType)

Determines whether we must track out-of-proc, or whether inproc tracking will work.

public static bool ForceOutOfProcTracking (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType toolType);
toolType
ExecutableType

The executable type for the tool being tracked

Returns
Boolean

True if we need to track out-of-proc, false if inproc tracking is OK

ForceOutOfProcTracking(ExecutableType,String,String)

Determines whether we must track out-of-proc, or whether inproc tracking will work.

public static bool ForceOutOfProcTracking (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType toolType, string dllName, string cancelEventName);
toolType
ExecutableType

The executable type for the tool being tracked

dllName
String

The tool being tracked.

cancelEventName
String

The name of the cancel event tracker should listen for, or null if there isn't one

Returns
Boolean

True if we need to track out-of-proc, false if inproc tracking is OK

FormatRootingMarker(ITaskItem)

Construct a rooting marker string from the ITaskItem array of primary sources.

public static string FormatRootingMarker (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem source);
source
ITaskItem

The primary sources.

Returns
String

Returns the marker string.

FormatRootingMarker(ITaskItem[])

Construct a rooting marker string from the ITaskItem array of primary sources.

public static string FormatRootingMarker (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] sources);
sources
ITaskItem[]

ITaskItem array of primary sources.

Returns
String

Returns the marker string.

FormatRootingMarker(ITaskItem,ITaskItem)

Construct a rooting marker string from the ITaskItem array of primary sources.

public static string FormatRootingMarker (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem source, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem output);
source
ITaskItem

The primary sources.

output
ITaskItem

The output files.

Returns
String

Returns the marker string.

FormatRootingMarker(ITaskItem[],ITaskItem[])

Construct a rooting marker string from the ITaskItem array of primary sources.

public static string FormatRootingMarker (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] sources, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] outputs);
sources
ITaskItem[]

ITaskItem array of primary sources.

outputs
ITaskItem[]

The output files.

Returns
String

Returns the marker string.

GetFileTrackerPath(ExecutableType)

Given the ExecutableType of the tool being wrapped and information that we know about our current bitness, figures out and returns the path to the correct FileTracker.dll.

public static string GetFileTrackerPath (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType toolType);
toolType
ExecutableType

The ExecutableType of the tool being wrapped.

Returns
String

Returns the path of the tool.

GetFileTrackerPath(ExecutableType,String)

Given the ExecutableType of the tool being wrapped and information that we know about our current bitness, figures out and returns the path to the correct FileTracker.dll.

public static string GetFileTrackerPath (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType toolType, string rootPath);
toolType
ExecutableType

The toolType.

rootPath
String

The root path for FileTracker.dll. Overrides the toolType if specified.

Returns
String

Returns String.

GetTrackerPath(ExecutableType)

Given the ExecutableType of the tool being wrapped and information that we know about our current bitness, figures out and returns the path to the correct Tracker.exe.

public static string GetTrackerPath (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType toolType);
toolType
ExecutableType

The ExecutableType of the tool being wrapped.

Returns
String

Returns the tracker path.

GetTrackerPath(ExecutableType,String)

Given the ExecutableType of the tool being wrapped and information that we know about our current bitness, figures out and returns the path to the correct Tracker.exe.

public static string GetTrackerPath (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType toolType, string rootPath);
toolType
ExecutableType

The toolType.

rootPath
String

The root path for Tracker.exe. Overrides the toolType if specified.

Returns
String

Returns String.

ResumeTracking()

Resume tracking file accesses in the current tracking context.

public static void ResumeTracking ();

SetThreadCount(Int32)

Set the global thread count, and assign that count to the current thread.

public static void SetThreadCount (int threadCount);
threadCount
Int32

The thread count.

StartTrackingContext(String,String)

Starts tracking file accesses.

public static void StartTrackingContext (string intermediateDirectory, string taskName);
intermediateDirectory
String

The directory into which to write the tracking log files

taskName
String

The name of the task calling this function, used to determine the names of the tracking log files

StartTrackingContextWithRoot(String,String,String)

Starts tracking file accesses, using the rooting marker in the response file provided. To automatically generate a response file given a rooting marker, call FileTracker.CreateRootingMarkerResponseFile.

public static void StartTrackingContextWithRoot (string intermediateDirectory, string taskName, string rootMarkerResponseFile);
intermediateDirectory
String

The directory into which to write the tracking log files

taskName
String

The name of the task calling this function, used to determine the names of the tracking log files

rootMarkerResponseFile
String

The rooting marker in the response file.

StopTrackingAndCleanup()

Stop tracking file accesses and get rid of the current tracking contexts.

public static void StopTrackingAndCleanup ();

SuspendTracking()

Temporarily suspend tracking of file accesses in the current tracking context.

public static void SuspendTracking ();
